authors.author: Fanny J. Crosby William H. Doane

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Draw me nearer, nearer blessed Lord, newline To the cross where Thou hast died. newline Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer blessed Lord. newline To Thy precious bleeding side.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: I am Thine O Lord; I have heard Thy voice, newline And it told Thy love to me. newline But I long to rise in the arms of faith, newline And be closer drawn to Thee.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Consecrate me now to Thy service Lord, newline By the power of grace divine. newline Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope, newline And my will be lost in Thine.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Oh the pure delight of a single hour newline That before Thy throne I spend, newline When I kneel in prayer and with Thee my God, newline I commune as friend with friend!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: There are depths of love that I cannot know newline Till I cross the narrow sea; newline There are heights of joy that I may not reach newline Till I rest in peace with Thee.
